content.question:
<math alttext="A g 2 C O 3 solid is in equilibrium with 2 A g with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus C O 3 with a negative 2 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
The chemical equation above represents the equilibrium that exists in a saturated solution of <math alttext="A g 2 C O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the molar solubility of <math alttext="A g 2 C O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following mathematical expressions shows how to calculate <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> based on <math alttext="K sub s p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="S equals the square root of K sub s p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S equals the square root of the fraction K sub s p over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S equals the cube root of the fraction K sub s p over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mroot><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mroot></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S equals the cube root of the fraction K sub s p over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mroot><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mroot></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="S equals the cube root of the fraction K sub s p over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mroot><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mroot></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
